protocol_name: Evaluation of the sensitivity of a mini-barcode
protocol_name_html: Evaluation of the sensitivity of a mini-barcode
description:
We developed a mini-barcode based on the 12S rRNA gene to identify predator from scats in Tasmania. 

To test the sensitivity of our primers to detect low template DNA samples, we set up serial dilutions of six DNA extracts originating from museum samples, representing each of the six mammal predators that might be detected in Tasmania (Tasmanian devil, eastern quoll, spotted tail quoll, cat, dog and fox).
protocol_affiliation: Institute for Applied Ecology University of Canberra
manuscript_citation: Modave E, MacDonald AJ, Sarre SD, A single mini-barcode test to screen for Australian mammalian predators from environmental samples. GigaScience 6(8). doi: 10.1093/gigascience/gix052
authors: Elodie Modave, Anna J. MacDonald, Stephen D. Sarre

components.data: The DNA concentration of each original DNA extraction was determined using a QuBit Fluorometer and the Qubit dsDNA BR Assay Kit (Thermo Fisher) and diluted with ddH2O if necessary to obtain a starting concentration of 90 ng / µl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The DNA concentration of each original DNA extraction was determined using a QuBit Fluorometer and the Qubit dsDNA BR Assay Kit (Thermo Fisher) and diluted with ddH2O if necessary to obtain a starting concentration of 90 ng / µl

components.data:
set up a series of six 10 X dilutions from each of these “undiluted” (90 ng / µl) samples

from 90 ng / µl to 0.09 pg/µl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
set up a series of six 10 X dilutions from each of these “undiluted” (90 ng / µl) samples

from 90 ng / µl to 0.09 pg/µl

components.data:
For each dilution of each sample, perform three qPCR replicates (on a Viia7 Real-Time PCR system (Thermo Fisher Scientific)) : total volume of 25µl including 1X Gold buffer (Applied Biosystems), 2 mM MgCl2, 0.4 mg / ml BSA, 0.4 µM of each primer, 0.6 µl SYBR green (1:2000 Life Technologies nucleic acid gel stain), 0.25 mM of each dNTP, 1 unit of AmpliTaq GoldTM (Applied Biosystems) and 2 µl of the appropriate DNA dilution.

 

qPCR protocol: initial step of 95 °C for 5 mins; followed by 40 cycles of 95 °C for 30 s, 57 °C for 30 s and 72 ° for 30 s.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each dilution of each sample, perform three qPCR replicates (on a Viia7 Real-Time PCR system (Thermo Fisher Scientific)) : total volume of 25µl including 1X Gold buffer (Applied Biosystems), 2 mM MgCl2, 0.4 mg / ml BSA, 0.4 µM of each primer, 0.6 µl SYBR green (1:2000 Life Technologies nucleic acid gel stain), 0.25 mM of each dNTP, 1 unit of AmpliTaq GoldTM (Applied Biosystems) and 2 µl of the appropriate DNA dilution.

 

qPCR protocol: initial step of 95 °C for 5 mins; followed by 40 cycles of 95 °C for 30 s, 57 °C for 30 s and 72 ° for 30 s.

components.data:
Using the ViiA7 software v1.2.4 with a threshold of 5,000 ∆Rn, conduct a comparative CT analysis by calculating the mean CT value and the standard deviation across qPCR replicates for each dilution of each DNA sample.

Evaluate to which dilution the mini-barcode is effective.
